CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Noticeably , PSFDTBT exhibits significantly improved PSC performance when compares with the analogous 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1 ( Scheme 1 ) , which showed general PSC performance with PCE of about 3.1% in our previous report.

Let's think step by step.

1. PSFDT: This is likely a specific material name, possibly a type of polymer.
2. PSC: This stands for "Perovskite Solar Cell," which is a type of photovoltaic cell.
3. PCE: This stands for "Power Conversion Efficiency," which is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting sunlight into electricity.
4. 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1: This is likely another specific material name, also a type of polymer.

So, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are PSFDT and 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDT |
| 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1 |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Noticeably , PSFDTBT exhibits significantly improved PSC performance when compares with the analogous 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1 ( Scheme 1 ) , which showed general PSC performance with PCE of about 3.1% in our previous report.

Let's think step by step.

1. PSFDT: This is likely a specific type or name of a polymer. It could be considered a "Property Value" as it is the specific polymer being discussed, but since it is being compared to another polymer, it is more accurately considered a "Property Name" as it is the name of the property being compared (the specific polymer).
2. PSC: This stands for "Perovskite Solar Cell." It is a type of solar cell and is a "Property Name."
3. PCE: This stands for "Power Conversion Efficiency." It is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell and is a "Property Name."
4. 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1: This is likely the name of another specific polymer. It is a "Property Name" as it is the name of the property being compared to PSFDT.
5. Scheme 1: This is likely a reference to a diagram or illustration in the report. It is not a property name, but rather a "Property Value" as it refers to a specific diagram or illustration.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PSFDT: This is a specific type or name of a polymer that exhibits improved PSC performance. It is a "Property Name" as it refers to the specific material being discussed.
2. PSC: This stands for "Perovskite Solar Cell." It is a type of solar cell and is a "Property Name" as it refers to the specific property or application being discussed.
3. PCE: This stands for "Power Conversion Efficiency." It is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell and is a "Property Name" as it refers to a specific material property.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PSFDT (PSFDTBT) |
| Perovskite Solar Cell (PSC) |
| Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Noticeably , PSFDTBT exhibits significantly improved PSC performance when compares with the analogous 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1 ( Scheme 1 ) , which showed general PSC performance with PCE of about 3.1% in our previous report.

Let's think step by step.

1. PSFDT: This is likely a specific type or name of a polymer. It can be considered as a "Property Value" entity, representing the improved Polymer Solid State Film (PSSF) performance of PSFDT compared to P1.

2. PSC: This stands for Polymer Solar Cell. It is a type of solar cell technology. It can be considered as a "Property" entity, representing the overall performance of the PSFDT and P1 polymers in creating a functional solar cell.

3. PCE: This stands for Power Conversion Efficiency. It is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting solar energy into electrical energy. It can be considered as a "Property Value" entity, representing the specific efficiency values of 3.1% for P1 and improved performance for PSFDT.

4. Scheme 1: This is likely a reference to a diagram or illustration in the report. It is not a property or property value, but it provides context for understanding the comparison between PSFDT and P1.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PSFDT: This is a specific type or name of a polymer. It is a "Property Value" entity, representing the improved performance of PSFDT in creating a Polymer Solar Cell (PSC) compared to P1.

2. PCE: This stands for Power Conversion Efficiency. It is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting solar energy into electrical energy. It is a "Property Value" entity, representing the specific efficiency values of 3.1% for P1 and improved performance for PSFDT.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value          |
|-----------------------|
| Improved PSC performance of PSFDT |
| PCE of about 3.1% for P1 |
| Improved PSC performance of PSFDT (compared to P1's PCE of about 3.1%) |
